'Hans Spemann' (27 June 1869 â 9 September 1941) was a German embryologist who
was awarded a Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine in 1935 for his discovery of
the effect now known as embryonic induction, an influence, exercised by various
parts of the embryo, that directs the development of groups of cells into
particular tissues and organs.
categories: Nobel laureates in Physiology or Medicine
